Atlanta, GA Metro > Restaurants > Popeye's Chicken&Biscuits Popeye's Chicken&Biscuits (678) 344-4764 4865 Stone Mountain Hwy , Lilburn , GA | Directions 30047 33.826600 -84.097000 View Website Menu Share Save Own this Business? Thumbs Up Thumbs Down ? not rated yet Add a Photo Cuisine: Cajun&Creole , Chicken , Fast Food , Southern Price: $ Categories: Catering , Restaurants View More Restaurant Special Features: Carry Out , Lunch Spot , Family Style Dining , Family-Friendly Dining Payment Methods: MasterCard, Discover, Visa, American Express, Debit Card View Less At a Glance ? 0% food quality “When I got my food, I found my shrimp po boy had old, hard shrimp and stale bread.” Site Feedback Overview Tips (2) Photos (0) Write a Tip for Popeye's Chicken&Biscuit… Sign in to Write a Tip Write a Tip... optional
Tips for Popeye's Chicken&Biscuits Doesn't Recommend ATrain Joined 3 years ago 1.0 July 06, 2009 Fried chicken served here. I used to go to this store all the time but after two back to back nightly visits, I won't be coming back. The first night, the drive through attendant argued with me about what was on the sign out front and would not let me get that item. When I got my food, I found my shrimp po boy had old, hard shrimp and stale bread. Thinking this was just a bad night, I returned the following night to give them a second chance and got similar quality food with the chicken sandwich being dry, like over fried-hard dry. I gave up on this location after these experiences and haven't been back in a year. … View More View Less 0 Heart Doesn't Recommend Cadien Clark Joined 9 years ago July 22, 2008 Cajun-inspired chicken and biscuits chain proffers classic Southern favorites, seafood, sides and desserts with a tangy twist.. In Short This Cajun-style fast food restaurant first opened in New Orleans in 1972 and has since achieved domestic and international fame for its flavorful mild and spicy chicken. In addition to the storied buttermilk biscuits, seafood menu items range from fried popcorn shrimp and shrimp snack "Craver Paks" to chicken sausage jambalaya, catfish baskets and shrimp etouffee. More festive Louisiana regional fare--think red beans and rice, and Mardi Gras cheesecake--rounds out the menu. … View More View Less 0 Heart
